div.head: Jeremiah Dickeson Will.
div.p:
In the name of God Amen. The twenty ninth day of September in the year of our
Lord one Thousand six hundred and seventy three I Jeremiah Dickeson of Charles County
thanks be to God for the fame and calling to remembrance the uncertain Estate of
this Transitory life and that all flesh must yeild unto Death when it shall please
God to call those make Constitute Ordaine and Declare this my last will and
Testament in manner and form following reworking and adnulling by these preats
all and every Testament & Testament will & wills theretofore by me made & declared
either by word or writing and this is to be taken for my last will & Testament &
other and first being & sorry from the bottom of my heart for my sins
most humbly desiring forgiveness for the same I give and commit my soule unto
Almighty God my savoiur and redeemer in whome and by the merits of Jesus
Christ and believe apuredly to be saved & to have full reunification & forgiveness of sins
and that my soule with my body all the general day of reunification shall use againe
with Joy and through the merits of Christs Death and passion profits and inheret the
Kingdom of heaven prepared for the Eleet and chosen and my body to be buried in such
place whereit shall please my Estate & such goods Chattle & debts as it hath pleased god for
above my desents to bestow whom me I doe give and displease of the same in manner
& form following that is to say first I will that all those Debts & that I have in
right or conceive to all manner of person or persons whatsoever shall be well and
truly Contented & paid on Ordaine to be paid weither Convenient Time after my
decrease by my Executor hereafter named.

Item I give and bequeath to my Godaughter Elizabeth Harrison one cow calf to be delivered
to
to her the next spring after my Decease.
Item. I give and bequeath unto each of my servants one cow and calf to be delivered to them as they are free.

Item. I give and bequeath unto my Loving friend Leche Greene four hundred pounds
of tobacco & .

Item. I give and bequeath all the rest of my Estate both real and personal to my
Sonne Thomas Dickeson to him and his heirs forever whome I wil & desire my
be brought up and be at the tuition of my Executors hereafter named until
he come to the age of three & twenty years & not to enjoy the Estate before
and after the he shall not sell or anywise make away with the Land but
shall fall to the heris begotten lawfully of his body which if he die wihtout
or before he come to the foresaid age I give and bequeath the personal Estate
unto my trusty & well loved friend Mr. Thomas Dent of S. Maries County
and Mr. Nicholas Proddly of Charles County whome also I nominate ordaine &
appoint Executors and overseers of this my lasy will & testament and my
Land and I give unto the poore of Charles County to be dispersed of and ordered at the
dispersion of my foresaid Executors & it is my desire that my said sonne Thomas
Dickeson be right two years at school & afterwards brought up to worke asfore
named Executor shall think he being seventeene years of age at Easter
after the date hereafter In Testimony whereof I have to this my last will & testament
put my hand & seal the day & year first above written

Signed & sealed
In the presence of us
John Gray-Matter his M
mark

On the back of the aforegoing was the following Endorsements (to will)
Maryland Js. By virtue of a commission from the Judge for probate of
wills and granting administration wiithin the province to me directed
and me Im proving bearing date the 20th day of April in the 48th year
of the Dominion of Cecelius &c anno Dom. 1675 I called before me Matter
& John Gray two witness to the within written will who proved the
same in common form in the 14th day of may 1675.
Benjamin Rozer

By Virtue of the Commission above mentioned on the 14th day of May
1675 I administrated by the Oath of an Executor unto Nicholas Brody ono
of the Executor Named in the within written will According to the form
in the saif Commission
Benj. Roger

May 14th 1675
Then administered the Oath of springer to Zachariah Wade & John Ward, to
appraise the Estate of Jeremiah Dickeson Decreased by Virue of a Commission
from the Judge in testontary cause. to me Dated the 20th of April
1675
8 1/4 sides
Benjamin Rozer
